subject: Re: Another opinion of the Ovilus
author: Chad
full_text:
Hey Ron,

I'm really glad someone is working with the Ovilus and letting those
of us who haven't purchased it know what you've found out concerning
the pros and cons. I'd appreciate it though if we could keep the forum
free of political statements and opinions, that is of course, unless
you're knocking Obama. lol

Thanks,

Chad


--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Ron Lederer <ronriko@...> wrote:
>
> From one user, here are a few things I have issues with.  
> 
> 1.  Unit only works off a 9 volt battery...no ac or other dc options
possible.  My battery goes down fast and they are not cheap and I know
of no way to recharge this type of battery.  Also, the battery seems
to drain even when not used (I mentioned this to Bill).
> 
> 2.  Mode selection at times does not change the mode when button is
pressed.  I often have to push the mode select many times to get it to
move to the next mode.
> 
> 3.  Dictonary mode seems to not offer anything but repeat words. 
Have not checked this very closely yet but I hear repeating words and
names...especially... Larry...often.  I have no confidence in this mode.
> 
> 4.  The phonemes and mix mode seem very limited in that I often do
not get any "energy" reading to allow sounds to be emitted. Although I
try to conduct my sessions in a calm mode myself, apparently I don't
have enough energy around me to get a consistant energy reading. 
> 
> 5.  Never tested other modes to determine value or usefulness except
for the yes/no and I found this to be totally out of touch.  Somethng
like McCain...sorry.
> 
> I do intend to work with the concepts Jeff put forth...but first I
need to go buy more batteries.  Also, I will dig out a clip I have
from one of my sessions and post it hear.  Maybe you can help me with
translation.  Ron
>
